title: Drawing, "Design for A Council Chamber and The Citadel, for Othello", 1932
signed: Signed in white chalk, upper right: E. Mck. K.
inscribed: Inscribed in white chalk, upper margin, with arrow pointing down: This for the general effect / for Council room.; in yellow crayon, beneath drawing: Council Hall; in white chalk, central margin: Cyprus.; lower left margin: detail for Cyprus; in yellow crayon, beneath lower drawing: Cyprus
creditline: Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer
description: Two designs for Othello setting. Upper design depicts the council hall with a seating area on the right in orange and yellow, and an arched doorway on the left; lower design depicts a street view of Cyprus, with a minaret in the center, crenellated wall, stairs and building with an arched doorway on the right, on the left a brick wall with a sort of draped canopy in orange and yellow. In the left margin: detail of the minaret with crenellation in white; below that, a sketch of the arched doorway with stairs on the opposite side. Two hole punched on left edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for A Council Chamber and The Citadel, for Othello", 1932.
1932. Color crayon on black paper. Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer. 1963-39-184.
